channel.title: Flinders Street, Melbourne - Latest - Google News

item.title: Flinders St car attack driver pleads guilty to murder - ABC News
item.description:
Flinders St car attack driver pleads guilty to murder  ABC News

By Karen Percy A man who killed an elderly man and injured others when he drove through a busy intersection on Flinders Street in Melbourne four days before Christmas last year has pleaded guilty. During a brief hearing in the Supreme Court of Victoria, Saeed Noori, 33, admitted to one charge of murder, 11 counts of recklessly causing serious injury and five counts of reckless conduct endangering life. Sixteen others were injured — many of them foreign nationals — when Noori drove at about 50 kilometres per hour by Flinders Street Station in the city at about 4:30pm on December 21. The 17 c...

item.title: Abacus, KKR mull $250m sale - The Australian
item.description:
Abacus, KKR mull $250m sale  The Australian

Industry sources told The Australian a number of interested parties have recently approached the joint venture partners about acquiring the Docklands building as Victoria Police prepared to move to a new home in Spencer Street.

Discussions are believed to be ongoing with the new bidders, but Abacus and KKR, which own a combined 70 per cent of the property, have not made a final decision on whether to sell.

The World Trade Centre’s presence on the market could present a repositioning opportunity in the middle of the CBD, which many active buyers have been keenly chas...

item.title: $10m package to clear homeless camp - The Advertiser
item.description:
$10m package to clear homeless camp  The Advertiser

Patience over the Flinders St camp is running out as new people arrive daily, and station staff fear for the safety of some owing to the anti-social behaviour of others. MAN ARRESTED AS FLINDERS STREET HOMELESS CAMP CLEARED PICTURE ESSAY: A DAY AT THE FLINDERS ST HOMELESS CAMP Also, Major Projects Victoria has warned that the area will need to be vacated: station renovations begin next week, and scaffolding will be erected along Flinders St. Housing Minister Martin Foley will today pledge immediate access to 40 transitional housing units across Melbourne, and 30 permanent relocatable homes ...

item.title: Lou and Jack are proof opposites attract - The Advertiser
item.description:
Lou and Jack are proof opposites attract  The Advertiser

You couldn’t breed a duo the same if you tried for 100 years, diametrically opposed in many ways yet smart way beyond some fancy uni degree. There are a hundred stories involving the pair, but I’ll recall just one, the time a few of us were invited back to the flat of another ex-footballer in Kevin “Skeeter” Coghlan. VICTORIANS TO FAREWELL LOU AT STATE FUNERAL MIKE SHEAHAN: LOU WAS KING OF VICTORIA LOUIE THE LIP BLAZED A TRAIL Skeeter explained he would be home soon and if his girlfriend was down the street buying a few provisions, just to let ourselves in. The flat was locked so we went do...

item.title: Townsville bar among best in Australia - The Advertiser
item.description:
Townsville bar among best in Australia  The Advertiser

Hooch & Fellow will go head to head with some of the best Australian bars in the New Bar, Small Bar and Regional Bar of the Year categories of the BartenderMagazine Australian Bar Awards. Owner Josh Agostino said it was a huge honour to be recognised, with their unique offerings set to put them a cut above the rest. “This is huge for us … we’re coming up on one year this month, so it’s a real honour,” he said. “It’s great to be recognised by your peers, to know that we really are doing something different for a regional area. “The biggest difference for people when they get here is table se...

item.title: Explosion sparks peak hour train delays - The Advertiser
item.description:
Explosion sparks peak hour train delays  The Advertiser

Passengers on board the affected train were forced to jump off and walk along Batman Ave to the nearby station. Herald Sun digital editor Nathaniel Bane was on the train directly behind. As his service was about to arrive at Flinders St the lights went out suddenly as the train lost power. “We were in darkness for a moment then the emergency lights came on,” he said. “The driver came on pretty quick and said there was an issue with the train ahead, it was stuck under the Batman Bridge because of an electrical fault, and we were going nowhere.” A fire engine was seen heading past minutes lat...

item.title: ‘Sportsman’s night, not a funeral’ - The Australian
item.description:
‘Sportsman’s night, not a funeral’  The Australian

The Collingwood champion, who died last Monday aged 94, would be the only person capable of “turning a state service into a sportsman’s night”, Richards’ close friend and journalist Tony Jones said. Richards was honoured today with a state funeral at St Paul’s Cathedral, a service attended by the biggest names in football and media. Lou Richards gallery Among them were Ron Barassi, triple-Brownlow Medallist Bob Skilton and Kevin Sheedy, Collingwood legends Des Tuddenham and Peter McKenna, current coach and Team of the Century member Nathan Buckley. Outside St Paul’s, hundreds of people gath...

item.title: Tram-surfing kids hitch a ride - The Advertiser
item.description:
Tram-surfing kids hitch a ride  The Advertiser

Footy fans were stunned on Sunday when they saw the boys, estimated to be between eight and 14-years-old, climbing the back of a moving route 70a tram at about 4pm. Husband and wife Steven and Anita said they feared for the safety of the group as the kids hung from the rear windscreen wipers and rainsoaked sides of the tram travelling along Flinders St. “If they’d fallen off they would have killed themselves because the tram was going probably as quick as it would down the street,” Steven told the Herald Sun. “There would have been at least six of them all hanging on for dear life,” he adde...

item.title: Australia Detains 5 in IS-inspired Christmas Day Bomb Plot - VOA News
item.description:
Australia Detains 5 in IS-inspired Christmas Day Bomb Plot  VOA News

Several people allegedly planning a series of bomb attacks in Melbourne, Australia, on Christmas Day have been arrested, and the plot was foiled, police said Friday. "This is a significant disruption of what we would describe as an imminent terrorist event in Melbourne," Australian Federal Police Commissioner Andrew Colvin told reporters in Sydney. "We do believe ... that we have removed this threat in its entirety." Originally, seven people, all in their 20s, were arrested, police said. But two people — a man and a woman — were released later Friday. Five men are still being detained, poli...

item.title: Rent a crowd clouds real issue - The Australian
item.description:
Rent a crowd clouds real issue  The Australian

But it is a complex issue. Demands for “law and order” will not help. But neither will the sort of lawless aggression co-ordinated by histrionic “professional protesters” witnessed in Melbourne’s CBD yesterday. If anything, the chaotic protest — in which a police officer was punched and several others were also assaulted — has only distracted from the core issue. Today, instead of talking about how we can accommodate those who have spent recent weeks camped outside Flinders Street Station, the news headlines are focused on the protesters, whose motivations need to be seriously questioned. T...

item.title: Man tasered after car threat - The Advertiser
item.description:
Man tasered after car threat  The Advertiser

There is a heavy police presence at Melbourne’s Flinders St after the incident at 8am that ended when police tasered the knife-wielding driver. Dramatic footage shows the man in some sort of body suit walking onto the road as he swung a baton. Officers have stopped traffic and trams in all directions as they bring the incident under control. The bomb squad is at the scene inspecting the vehicle amid reports the driver had something strapped to his waist. The drama comes on a day when the Victorian capital will be packed with fans attending the AFL grand final at the MCG and amid increasing ...

item.title: Police targeting ‘fake’ beggars - The Australian
item.description:
Police targeting ‘fake’ beggars  The Australian

While the Andrews government yesterday acknowledged there was a “serious homeless problem” in Victoria, chief police commissioner Graham Ashton claimed people were often choosing to live on the streets “I think it looks disgusting what you see in the city,” Mr Ashton said, insisting there were ­adequate beds and accommo­dation for those in need. “There’s no reason that anyone should be sleeping on the street, there’s no reason that anyone should be homeless. “Quite often what happens is they don’t want to be in those ­assisted accommodation or that emergency accommodation, they choose to be...

item.title: Man arrested in Sydney over NYE terror threat - The Advertiser
item.description:
Man arrested in Sydney over NYE terror threat  The Advertiser

Police from the NSW Terrorism Investigation Squad arrested the 40-year-old man after he got off a flight from London. They were acting on receiving information from the public. A search warrant was executed on a home in Chippendale and a storage facility in the inner west. Documents and hard drives were seized during the search. The man was taken to Mascot Police Station where he was charged with ‘Documents containing threats contrary to Section 31 Crimes Act 1900 concerning online blogs’. He was refused bail and will appear at Parramatta Court today. The threat comes after police successfu...

item.title: 'He tried to kill me': Man arrested after driving erratically in Melbourne's CBD - ABC News
item.description:
'He tried to kill me': Man arrested after driving erratically in Melbourne's CBD  ABC News

A man wearing a motorcycle helmet and dressed in black who was allegedly armed with a weapon, was tasered and arrested by police after driving erratically in Melbourne's CBD on AFL grand final day. External Link: Tweet: Police outside Flinders St after man arrested Police were called to the intersection of Swanston and Flinders Streets, outside Flinders Street Station and Federation Square around 8:00am. Victoria Police Acting Superintendent Wayne Newman said they were treating it as a mental health incident and there were no links to terrorism. The man, believed to be in his early 20s, has...

item.title: Anton looks to offload tower - The Australian
item.description:
Anton looks to offload tower  The Australian

Anton is looking to capitalise on the market heat by offering the tower at 120 Spencer Street, near Southern Cross station in the CBD, that it picked up for $165m. Real estate firm CBRE is ­rumoured to have approached ­select groups to test their interest in the tower. The 22-level complex has a fully let income of more than $14m. It showed a fully let yield of more than 7 per cent when Anton bought it but recent deals have been struck at tighter levels by both local and offshore groups. The 33,000sq m tower has had strong interest since anchor tenant AGL left for the Docklands and only a f...

item.title: Lou’s service bigger than Texas - The Australian
item.description:
Lou’s service bigger than Texas  The Australian

It was a larger-than-life boast by “Louie the Lip”, the Collingwood captain and television icon who became exactly that — a character far bigger and bolder than his stature. The claim may have been exaggerated as much as the outlandish nicknames he gave to footballers, but as proved yesterday at Richards’s state funeral, he was not far wrong. A hall of fame of football and media identities joined family and friends at a service in St Paul’s Cathedr­al in Melbourne honouring Collingwood’s 1953 premiership captain, who died last week aged 94. Among them were Ron Barassi, triple Brownlow medal...

item.title: Aussie Police Foil Christmas Attack - The Daily Beast
item.description:
Aussie Police Foil Christmas Attack  The Daily Beast

Five men were arrested in Australia on Friday on suspicion of plotting a series of bombings in Melbourne on Christmas, police said. The suspects were identified only as men between the ages of 21 and 26, with four of them born in Australia and the fifth in Egypt. Victoria state Police Chief Commissioner Graham Ashton said the men were inspired by the Islamic State and were planning attacks on the city’s Flinders Street train station, neighboring Federation Square and St. Paul’s Cathedral, CBS News reported. The men were believed to be planning a series of attacks using explosives, knives an...

item.title: Why our train stations are so shabby - The Advertiser
item.description:
Why our train stations are so shabby  The Advertiser

Urban design expert Professor Peter Bishop, from University College London, told news.com.au he had the full backing of politicians to take land owners to court in the UK capital who wanted to demolish historic structures or construct bland buildings. Australian politicians shouldn’t be afraid of doing the same, he said. If not, far from becoming the future Grand Centrals of the southern hemisphere, Sydney’s Central and Melbourne’s Flinders Street may end up as shabby second rate stations. Both stations, as well as Brisbane Central, are due to have millions lavished on them — but some of th...

item.title: Train passenger's phone photos prompt security check at Melbourne station - ABC News
item.description:
Train passenger's phone photos prompt security check at Melbourne station  ABC News

A report of a train passenger looking at dead bodies on a mobile phone prompted a safety check at Melbourne's Flinders Street station during the morning peak, the state's police Chief Commissioner says. Police said the station area had been deemed safe after police conducted the check, which caused a major delay on at least one train line. External Link: Victoria Police tweet re Flinders St The check was conducted amid heightened security concerns following a terrorist attack in London, where a speeding car ran down pedestrians on Westminster Bridge, before crashing into the railings surrou...

item.title: Swiss win war for M&G’s CBD site - The Australian
item.description:
Swiss win war for M&G’s CBD site  The Australian

M&G put the building at 628 Bourke Street on the market in March via Leigh Melbourne and Nick Rathgeber of Colliers International and a fierce bidding war ensued. The 16-level tower is packed with ASX-listed companies and Victorian government departments. It spans about 24,732sq m and has a weighted average lease expiry of five years. The buyer may also capitalise on the opportunity to lift income in the medium term on the 3301sq m site. The building sits just 150m from Southern Cross station and has four frontages, presenting substantial long-term redevelopment value. A sale will show a ha...

item.title: Protecting people in crowded spaces 'a significant challenge' for police - ABC News
item.description:
Protecting people in crowded spaces 'a significant challenge' for police  ABC News

The terrorist attacks in Spain on Friday are a stark reminder for Australian law enforcement officials about how difficult it is to protect people in crowded spaces, the head of Victoria Police's counter terrorism command says. Places such as sporting venues, schools and public transport all pose "significant challenges" to law enforcement, according to Ross Guenther, the Assistant Commissioner for the Victoria Police counter-terrorism command. Do bollards make cities safer? They are a concrete reminder of the new, heightened terrorist threat — but do the bollards popping up in Australian c...

item.title: Plea after $1bn ice haul - The Australian
item.description:
Plea after $1bn ice haul  The Australian

The Australian Federal Police and Victoria Police are searching for two men and a flashy white sports car they believe were involved in the operation. Police seized 903kg of crystal methamphetamine — worth almost $1 billion — after it was allegedly smuggled through a Melbourne port from Asia in a shipment of 70 boxes of wooden floorboards. The ice allegedly was found in hidden panels inside the 2m-long floorboards during a raid on a warehouse in the eastern suburb of Nunawading on February 6. Two men, a 53-year-old Blackburn man and a 36-year-old Doncaster man, were arrested several days be...

item.title: Stairs too short in jet rescue - The Australian
item.description:
Stairs too short in jet rescue  The Australian

Amid mounting criticism over the handling of the Melbourne Airport incident last week, Victoria Police has confirmed stairs were requested early in the operation but wouldn’t say how long it took for them to arrive. “The door chosen … was the most rear door away from the (suspected) device, however, the operator of the stairs indicated that they would not reach that door height,” Victoria Police media officer Melissa Seach said. “It was subsequently redirected to the next door along. The time taken to redirect towards the newly chosen door took another 90 seconds at the most.” The revelatio...

item.title: Lawyer calls for new racial profiling case against Victoria Police - ABC News
item.description:
Lawyer calls for new racial profiling case against Victoria Police  ABC News

The lawyer who spearheaded a federal court case against Victoria Police over allegations of racial profiling has urged others to take up the legal fight, insisting the discriminatory practice still occurs. Tamar Hopkins is a former principal solicitor at Melbourne's Flemington Kensington Community Legal Centre, which represented six young African men in the landmark case. The men alleged that between 2005 and 2009 officers breached the Racial Discrimination Act by stopping and searching them for no other reason than their ethnicity. Audio: Listen to the full investigation (Background Briefi...

item.title: Violent confrontations on Flinders Street as police move on homeless - ABC News
item.description:
Violent confrontations on Flinders Street as police move on homeless  ABC News

Violence that broke out when authorities moved a group of homeless people from outside Flinders Street Station was caused not by the homeless, but by protesters, police say. Key points: - A police officer was punched in violent protests at Flinders St - Police were moving on a homeless camp to make way for scaffolding - Accommodation has been offered for three days for those moved The group of about 20 homeless people was asked to leave to allow for the erection of scaffolding and building works at the station. Acting Commander Stuart Bateson said five arrests were made during the operation...

item.title: Accused Flinders Street driver has paranoid schizophrenia, court told - ABC News
item.description:
Accused Flinders Street driver has paranoid schizophrenia, court told  ABC News

By Sarah Farnsworth The man accused of deliberately driving a car into pedestrians on Flinders Street in Melbourne's CBD, killing one and injuring more than a dozen others, has been diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia, a court has been told. But the court is still waiting on a psychiatric assessment to determine if Saeed Noori can plead not guilty by reason of mental impairment. The 33-year-old is facing one charge of murder and 17 counts of attempted murder over the alleged attack at the busy intersection of Flinders and Elizabeth streets on December 21 last year. Mr Noori was initially ...

item.title: Why is Flinders Lane not called Little Flinders Street? - ABC News
item.description:
Why is Flinders Lane not called Little Flinders Street?  ABC News

The back lanes of Melbourne CBD's main streets are named for their bigger siblings. Lonsdale Street has Little Lonsdale Street, Bourke Street has Little Bourke Street, Collins Street has Little Collins Street. But Flinders Street bucks the convention with its back street, Flinders Lane. That sparked the interest of former Melbourne resident Paul Bellios, so he contacted Curious Melbourne, an initiative where you can ask questions you'd like an ABC journalist to investigate. Paul's question was simple: Why wasn't Flinders Lane called Little Flinders Street? It turns out that, until 1948, it ...

item.title: More CBD bollards on the way - The Australian
item.description:
More CBD bollards on the way  The Australian

The Victorian government last year committed $10m to security upgrades, many of which are already under way, including the installation of temporary and permanent bollards and landscaped barriers throughout Melbourne’s CBD. An alarm and loudspeaker system to direct pedestrians during emergencies was announced in December. Australia’s terrorism threat is listed as “probable” and vehicle ­attacks are becoming increasingly common around the world. The upgrades come after the Bourke Street attack in January last year, and Flinders Street attack in December, which saw motor vehicles used as weap...

item.title: Two stabbed with 'edged weapon' in Melbourne CBD - ABC News
item.description:
Two stabbed with 'edged weapon' in Melbourne CBD  ABC News

A man and a woman have been stabbed near Melbourne's Flinders Street train station this morning, leaving one fighting for life. Police said there was a fight between two groups of people on the corner of Flinders and Elizabeth streets about 4:30am. "It is believed an altercation took place between two groups which resulted in a man and a woman being assaulted with an edged weapon near the intersection of Flinders Street," Senior Constable Alistair Parsons said in a statement. The man, in his 30s, has been taken to the Royal Melbourne Hospital with life-threatening injuries to his upper body...

item.title: Explosive CCTV of teen’s Melbourne CBD car rampage - The Advertiser
item.description:
Explosive CCTV of teen’s Melbourne CBD car rampage  The Advertiser

The CCTV footage, released by the Herald Sun exclusively, comes as police reveal the teen had searched online for military bases, city landmarks and high-grade weapons. The explosive video shows the boy, 15, driving at pedestrians and cyclists, doing skids in front of Flinders Street Station and running red lights shortly before 8am on September 30. POLICE SHUT DOWN PARTS OF FLINDERS ST FOLLOWING AFL GRAND FINAL INCIDENT WITH CAR MELBOURNE CBD SECURITY: SIRENS, BOLLARDS AND CCTV TO SECURE CITY On the corner of Swanston and Flinders streets, the stolen car the teen was driving reverses into ...

item.title: Don't be scared to celebrate New Year's Eve in Melbourne: police - ABC News
item.description:
Don't be scared to celebrate New Year's Eve in Melbourne: police  ABC News

A thousand extra police officers will be deployed around Melbourne on New Year's Eve, but officers say there's no specific threat to the festivities and Melburnians can be confident they will be safe. Extra concrete bollards will be installed in the city and at Docklands and both areas will be closed to traffic, as the city remains cautious after the recent Flinders Street car attack and the November arrest of a man who allegedly planned to shoot at New Year's Eve crowds. Between 300,000 and 500,000 people are expected in the CBD on Sunday night for the annual fireworks display, which the C...

item.title: Melbourne car crash: Bewilderment, resignation, and anger as city's residents take stock - The Independent
item.description:
Melbourne car crash: Bewilderment, resignation, and anger as city's residents take stock  The Independent

It’s all gone quiet on Flinders Street. Darkness has fallen, and normally at this time of night the streets are teeming with life: young people climbing the steps into the train station, weaving in and out of the bars and backpacker hostels and all-night chip shops. But tonight, all is still. No pedestrians, no cars; no cars but one. On the pavement outside the train station, behind a police cordon, a smashed white Suzuki SUV is slowly being winched onto a tow truck. Above, the signal it ran through six hours earlier is still on red. A few feet away, a council works vehicle arrives with fre...

item.title: 'All you could hear was hits and screams': Horror in Melbourne's CBD - ABC News
item.description:
'All you could hear was hits and screams': Horror in Melbourne's CBD  ABC News

Witnesses have described hearing screams and seeing bodies "thrown into the air" after a vehicle ploughed into pedestrians outside Melbourne's Flinders Street Station. Witness Jim owns a bake shop on Flinders Street and said the incident happened on one of the busiest corners in Melbourne. "He seemed to be travelling at about 80-100 kilometres [per hour] down Flinders Street in a westerly direction," he said. "The intersection was full of pedestrians and he ploughed through pedestrians. "The only thing slowing him down was him hitting pedestrians. "It was packed. Our stores was packed. The ...

item.title: Security boost for Boxing Day Test as Victorians warned against 'silly choices' - ABC News
item.description:
Security boost for Boxing Day Test as Victorians warned against 'silly choices'  ABC News

Victorians have been urged to remain vigilant and avoid making "silly choices" over the festive season following a car attack at Flinders Street in Melbourne, with heightened security at the Boxing Day Test match and other major events. Nineteen people were taken to hospital when a car crashed into pedestrians on Flinders Street in Melbourne's CBD on Thursday afternoon. Saeed Noori, 32, is accused of deliberately driving the four-wheel drive into the crowd and is currently in police custody. He has not yet been charged. Premier Daniel Andrews said of those taken to hospital, 12 people remai...

item.title: Melbourne car ramming: four people critically injured and driver arrested - The Guardian
item.description:
Melbourne car ramming: four people critically injured and driver arrested  The Guardian

Four people have been critically injured after a car ploughed through a busy intersection outside the Flinders Street station in Melbourne in what police have described as a “deliberate act”. The driver of the vehicle, a 32-year-old man, was arrested by an off-duty police sergeant who was on the scene within 15 seconds of the incident, the acting police commissioner, Shane Patton, told reporters at a press conference on Thursday night. A 24-year-old man seen filming the incident, which occurred at 4.30pm local time, was also arrested. Patton said it was unknown what his relationship was, if...

item.title: Witnesses describe chaos: ‘There were bodies on the ground ... it was mayhem’ - The Advertiser
item.description:
Witnesses describe chaos: ‘There were bodies on the ground ... it was mayhem’  The Advertiser

Witnesses described the chaos of seeing people “flying into the air” while others dodged the car and ran for their lives. PEDESTRIANS HIT IN MELBOURNE CBD FLINDERS STREET INCIDENT: WHAT WE KNOW SO FAR Then two final loud thuds. One last person was hit and then the car hit the tram stop bringing the ordeal to an end. But a trail of destruction was left on the streets. Melburnians united in the middle of Flinders St to help the injured on one of the city’s busiest crossings filled with more than 100 Christmas shoppers, workers, and tourists. Lachlan Read said when he first heard thumping nois...

item.title: Live: Car hits pedestrians near Melbourne's Flinders Street Station - ABC News
item.description:
Live: Car hits pedestrians near Melbourne's Flinders Street Station  ABC News

Police have arrested a driver after a vehicle collided with pedestrians near Melbourne's Flinders Street Station. Follow our blog for live updates. External Link: Flinders St Station incident live blog link

item.title: Melbourne attack driver had mental health issues but no terror connection - CNN
item.description:
Melbourne attack driver had mental health issues but no terror connection  CNN

The driver of a car which plowed into Christmas shoppers in Melbourne Thursday had a history of drug use and mental health issues, police said. Acting chief commissioner of Victoria Police Shane Patton told reporters that while the crash was considered to be deliberate, there was no evidence of a link to terrorism. Eighteen people were injured, including at least one young child, when the car hit pedestrians outside Melbourne's iconic Flinders Street station just after 4.40 p.m. local time. Latest developments - Police said the 32-year-old driver was the sole occupant of the white Suzuki 4W...

item.title: Multiple pedestrians hit by vehicle outside Melbourne’s Flinders Street Station - RT
item.description:
Multiple pedestrians hit by vehicle outside Melbourne’s Flinders Street Station  RT

A car has rammed into pedestrians in Melbourne, Australia. Police say the extent of the injuries is not known, while local media is reporting several casualties. The driver has been arrested. The incident occurred on Flinders Street between Elizabeth and Swanston streets. Paramedics are assessing 12 people on the site, and two people were taken to the hospital, including one child in serious condition. “As it (the car) approached this intersection here… it just mowed everybody down, people were flying everywhere,” Sue, a witness, told 3AW Drive. Police are currently attending an incident on...

item.title: Downed tram lines cause traffic issues in Melbourne's CBD - ABC News
item.description:
Downed tram lines cause traffic issues in Melbourne's CBD  ABC News

Melbourne is experiencing traffic problems during the morning peak period after a truck got hooked on overhead tram lines and pulled them down at a busy CBD intersection. Police said a truck driver towing an excavator was performing a U-turn at the intersection of Flinders and Williams streets when it hooked onto tram power lines. The truck travelled several hundred metres, tearing down the lines, Detective Inspector Wayne Newman said. "The truck driver was unaware at that stage that collision had taken place and has proceeded to travel another few hundred metres, dragging down those power ...

item.title: The science behind Flinders Street Station's new look - ABC News
item.description:
The science behind Flinders Street Station's new look  ABC News

The scaffolding is slowly coming off Flinders Street Station, revealing the Melbourne icon's brand new colours. Or should we say old colours? After all, the repaint is designed to be as close as possible to the station's first paint job from 1910. But how do we know what colours the station was painted in if all the photos of it are in black and white? Science, that's how. Layers 'like a liquorice allsort' The architects in charge of the station's refurbishment, Lovell Chen, determined from newspaper records that Flinders Street Station had been repainted at least five times. Melbourne Univ...
